proposals.title: Predicting Customer Churn
proposals.description: This use case focuses on predicting whether a customer will churn (stop purchasing) based on their historical purchase behavior.  We can leverage the transaction data to identify patterns and features associated with churn.  A model trained on this data can then be used to proactively identify at-risk customers, allowing the business to intervene with retention strategies.
kpis: Churn rate reduction: Measure the percentage decrease in customer churn after implementing the prediction model.
Customer retention rate improvement: Track the increase in the percentage of customers retained after implementing the model.
Return on investment (ROI) of retention efforts: Calculate the financial return generated by targeted retention efforts based on model predictions.
proposals.business_value: By predicting customer churn, businesses can proactively implement targeted retention strategies, reducing churn and improving customer lifetime value.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will predict the probability of a customer churning. A probability above a certain threshold (e.g., 0.6) would indicate a high likelihood of churn. For example, a prediction of 0.75 for CustomerID 1234 suggests a 75% chance they will churn; CustomerID 5678 with a prediction of 0.2 indicates a 20% chance they'll churn. The business can prioritize customers with high churn probabilities for retention actions.
proposals.target variable understanding: CustomerID is a categorical variable representing unique customers. The number of unique predictions will be the number of unique CustomerIDs.  Each CustomerID will be classified as likely to churn or not.

proposals.title: Predicting Total Sales Value
proposals.description: This use case focuses on predicting the total sales value for each customer.  This prediction can help in customer segmentation, resource allocation, and targeted marketing campaigns.  A regression model can be trained on the transaction data to learn the relationship between various customer features and their total spending.
kpis: Accuracy of sales prediction: Measure the model's ability to accurately predict total sales value for each customer.
Improvement in sales forecasting: Compare the accuracy of sales forecasts using the AI model to traditional forecasting methods.
Increased sales revenue: Track the increase in sales revenue generated as a result of targeted marketing and resource allocation based on model predictions.
proposals.business_value: Accurate sales value prediction helps businesses improve resource allocation, target marketing campaigns, and ultimately increase sales revenue.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will predict the total sales value for a given customer. For example, if the model predicts a total sales value of $1000 for CustomerID 1234, this represents the expected total amount this customer will spend. This information helps to personalize offers based on expected spend and manage resources accordingly.
proposals.target variable understanding: TotalSalesValue is a continuous variable representing total sales for each customer.  The number of unique predictions will equal the number of unique CustomerIDs.

proposals.title: Customer Segmentation based on Purchase Behavior
proposals.description: This use case aims to segment customers based on their purchasing patterns using unsupervised learning techniques.  By identifying distinct groups of customers with similar purchasing behavior, the business can tailor its marketing strategies and improve customer experience. The model will group customers with similar purchase characteristics.
kpis: Number of distinct customer segments: Determine the optimal number of clusters to effectively segment the customer base.
Segment profile clarity:  Analyze the characteristics of each customer segment to understand their unique needs and preferences.
Customer satisfaction improvement:  Measure the impact of tailored marketing and services on customer satisfaction within each segment.
proposals.business_value: Customer segmentation enables businesses to personalize their marketing and customer service efforts, leading to improved customer loyalty and increased revenue.
proposals.prediction_interpretation: The model will assign each customer to a specific cluster (segment). Customers within the same cluster exhibit similar purchase behaviors. For example, CustomerID 1234 and 5678 might be in Cluster A, indicating they are frequent buyers of high-value items.  Cluster B might represent customers who buy infrequently and lower-value items.
proposals.target variable understanding: CustomerID is used as input for clustering.  The number of unique predictions will be equal to the number of clusters identified by the model. Each CustomerID is assigned to a specific cluster.
